thread.title: Jailed OSU soccer player has prior public indecency convictions
thread.title_full: Jailed OSU soccer player has prior public indecency convictions

title: Jailed OSU soccer player has prior public indecency convictions
text:
Jailed OSU soccer player has prior public indecency convictions An Oregon State University soccer player charged with public indecency has prior convictions for a similar offense. Post to Facebook Jailed OSU soccer player has prior public indecency convictions An Oregon State University soccer player charged with public indecency has prior convictions for a similar offense.   KGW.com: http://on.kgw.com/1Lk8mLp   Join the Conversation To   Jailed OSU soccer player has prior public indecency convictions KGW Staff and Associated Press 9:41 a.m. PDT October 8, 2015 David James Brown was arrested Sept. 30 for allegedly masturbating while standing naked outside a woman's residence. (Photo: Benton County jail) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
CORVALLIS, Ore. (AP) - An Oregon State University soccer player charged with public indecency after an alleged incident in which he exposed himself to a woman near campus has prior convictions for a similar offense. 
David James Brown was arrested Sept. 30 for allegedly masturbating while standing naked outside a woman's residence. He has since pleaded not guilty to public indecency and sex abuse charges. 
More: Arrest after naked man frightens women near Oregon State campus 
Court documents say the 19-year-old soccer player was convicted of two counts of indecent exposure in Texas in July 2014. 
University spokesman Steve Clark told the Corvallis Gazette-Times that the school was unaware of his criminal history. Last February, the athletic department singled out Brown for praise on its website. 
Brown has extensive experience with the Houston Dynamo Academy as well as the Dallas Texans club system. He was invited to play in international friendlies against Chivas, Tecos and Chiapas while with the Dynamo Academy. He was the 2014 Dynamo Alumni Cup Man of the Match. 
“David is one of the better youth left backs in the country.” Simmons said. “He is a strong 1v1 defender and can get forward to help in the attack. His cultured left foot provides a wide variety of passing ranges.” 
Brown also helped Dallas Texans win the U13 Tivoli Cup and make the semi-finals of the Gothia Cup while playing as a guest-player. 
Following Brown's arrest, references to him as a member of the soccer team's freshmen recruit class were removed from the school's website. 
Clark said that was done in error. The changes were restored online Wednesday. He has been suspended indefinitely from the soccer team and he does not appear on the team roster. 
Brown remains in jail on $160,000 bail. 
He may also face other university sanctions up to and including expulsion, Clark told the Gazette-Times.
